intro: Alonsoa incisifolia var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Its botanical features make it a notable species in tropical horticulture and ecological studies.
